Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CM4 (Ctriporin analog G4K,G8K,S11K,A12K, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Luo X, Deng H, Ding L, Ye X, Sun F, Qin C, Chen Z.2024
Literature.Title: Cationicity Enhancement on the Hydrophilic Face of Ctriporin Significantly Reduces Its Hemolytic Activity and Improves the Antimicrobial Activity against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (78.95%) toCtriporinK: 32%, I=L: 16%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 (MIC 1.8-3.6 uM), E. faecium ATCC29212 (MIC 7.1 uM), E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 3.6-7.1 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 7.1 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 14.2 uM), A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 1.8 uM).In vitro toxicity:  human RBC: HC50> 500 ug/ml. 20% hemolysis at 500 ug/ml, poor hemo.lytic.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS micelles.
